Name: ECS RED COMP 4.5.4.2
checklistText:
<size=21>4.5.4.2 ECS Redundant Component Check</size>

	1	Suit compr
Panel 4		SUIT COMPR (both) 					- redundant compr
Panel 2		SUIT COMPR ΔP ind 					- 0.3-0.4 psid

	2	Suit demand regs
Panel 380	DEMAND REG sel 					- 1
			Close demand reg cab bleed port with finger
				NOTE: 	click on the hole left of the RETURN VALVE.
						It will remain held for 2 seconds.
Panel 2		O2 FLOW ind 						- mom incr
Panel 380	DEMAND REG sel 					- 2
			Close demand reg cab bleed port with finger
Panel 2		O2 FLOW ind 						- mom incr
Panel 380	DEMAND REG sel 					- BOTH

	3	Main O2 regs
Panel 351	MN REG B 							- close
			EMER CAB PRESS sel 				- 1
			EMER CAB PRESS TEST pb 			- push
Panel 2		O2 FLOW ind 						- pegged hi
Panel 351	MN REG B 							- open
			MN REG A 							- close
			EMER CAB PRESS sel 				- 2
			EMER CAB PRESS TEST pb 			- push
Panel 2		O2 FLOW ind 						- pegged hi
Panel 351	MN REG A 							- OPEN
			EMER CAB PRESS sel 				- BOTH (OFF if all 
												crewmen suited)
	4	H2O accum
Panel 2		SUIT H2O ACCUM AUTO 				- redundant accum
				O2 FLOW ind 					- mon for momentary (10 
												sec) incr
					Remarks: Allow up to 10 minutes for accumulator 
					stroking.

	5	Urine dump nozzle htrs
Panel 101	WASTE H2O DUMP 					- redundant htr
			URINE DUMP 						- redundant htr
				MSFN reports no significant change in urine & water 
					dump nozzle temps

	6	Open cool cont atten pnl

				WARNING
Panel 382	SUIT FLOW RELF vlv must remain OFF throughout msn or 
			swelling of CO2 odor absorber filters may result.

	7	Sec gly loop

					CAUTION
		Simultaneous oper of cryo O2 htrs & sec loop rad htrs will 
		result in low mn bus voltage (<26.5 vdc). This will be precluded 
		if the following precautions are observed.

Panel 2		If RAD PRIM OUT TEMP ind - ≤48°F preceding sec loop 
			activation, or if RAD SEC OUT TEMP ind - ≤45°F following sec 
			loop activation:

			•	Inhibit cryo O2 htrs whenever cryo tk press <900 psia 
				[O2 HTRS (both) - off (ctr)]. Enbl cryo htrs when RAD SEC 
				OUT TEMP ind - >48°F

			•	Enbl sec loop rad htrs when mn bus A & B ≥28.25 vdc 
				with 3 FC oper or ≥28.5 vdc with 2 FC oper.

Panel 382	SEC EVAP H2O CONT 					- AUTO
Panel 2		ECS IND sel 						- SEC
			GLY EVAP STM AUTO 				- MAN
			GLY EVAP STM INCR 					- INCR for 58 sec
Remarks: Steam pressure valve requires 58 seconds from full open
		to full closed. INCR position is momentary.

Panel 377	GLY TO RAD SEC vlv 				- NORM
Panel 2		RAD PRIM HTR 						- off (ctr)
Panel 4		GLY PUMPS 							- OFF
Panel 2		SEC COOL PUMP 						- AC1
				SEC GLY DISCH PRESS ind 		- 39-51 psig
				SEC ACCUM QTY ind 				- 30-55%
			RAD SEC HTR 						- on (up)
			SEC COOL EVAP 						- EVAP
			SEC GLY EVAP STM PRESS ind
				When boiling 					- 0.09-0.14 psia
				Not boiling 					- >0.14 psia
			After 20-30 min
				Remarks: Allow 20 to 30 minutes of glycol circulation 
				before reading temperature indicators.
				RAD SEC IN TEMP ind 			- 60°-97°F
				RAD SEC OUT TEMP ind 			- 40°-70°F (pegged)
				SEC GLY EVAP OUT TEMP ind 	- 40°-50.5°F
			SEC COOL PUMP 						- AC2
				SEC GLY DISCH PRESS ind 		- 39-51 psig
			SEC COOL EVAP 						- RSET for 58 sec min, 
												then off (ctr)
			Remarks: RSET closes steam pressure control valve. Steam 	
			pressure valve require 58 seconds from full open to full 
			close.
			RAD SEC HTR 						- OFF
Panel 377	GLY TO RAD SEC vlv 				- BYP
Panel 2		ECS IND sel 						- PRIM
			SEC COOL PUMP 						- off (ctr)
Panel 382	SEC EVAP H2O CONT 					- OFF

	8	Close cool cont atten pnl

	9	Prim gly pumps
Panel 4		GLY PUMPS 							- redundant pump
		Remarks: Switch to pump opposide that on at beginning of
			test. This verifies primary loop pump operation.
Panel 2			PRIM GLY DISCH PRESS ind 		- 40-52 psig
				PRIM ACCUM QTY ind 			- 30-65%
				GLY EVAP STM AUTO 			- AUTO

	10	Rad htrs
			RAD PRIM HTR 						- redundant htr
		Remarks: Switch to heater opposite that on at beginning of test. 
				"On" time of heater is function of radiator outlet 
				temperature and is cyclic in nature.

Steps.Text: Take note of what SUIT COMPRESSOR is active (only one should be)
Deactivate the SUIT COMPRESSOR previously used
Take note if SUIT CIRCUIT H2O ACCUM is set to AUTO 1 or AUTO 2 (MDC-2)
Set it to the redundant AUTO pos (opposite to above)
O2 FLOW ind - mon for momentary (10 sec) increase.
Take note of the WASTE H2O DUMP and URINE DUMP htr (A/B) switches (P101)
Set them to their redundant position (A/B)
6 - Open the Coolant Control panel cover
In the next step, hold the sw up (hold mouse button down) for 58 seconds.
SEC GLY DISCH PRESS ind - 39-51 psig
SEC GLY EVAP STM PRESS ind:
SEC GLY EVAP OUT TEMP ind - 40°-50.5°F
SEC GLY DISCH PRESS ind - 39-51 psig
Keep it in RESET for 58 seconds
8 - Close the Coolant Control panel cover
Set GLY PUMPS (Pnl 4) to the redundant pump
PRIM GLY DISCH PRESS ind - 40-52 psig
